This website contains the teaching materials for the **Statistical Population Modelling for Census Support workshop,** funded by the [United Nations Population Fund](<https://www.unfpa.org/>). It has been developed at the [WorldPop Research Group](<https://www.worldpop.org/>), University of Southampton.

It has been first taught to the Brazilian Stats Office, Instituto Brasileiro de Geografia e Estat√≠stica (IBGE), in October 2021.

## Material

-   [Introduction](tutorials/day1_presentation.html)
-   [Tutorial 1](tutorials/tutorial1/tutorial1_linearRegression.html): How to think like a Bayesian and build a first population model?
-   [Tutorial 2](tutorials/tutorial2/tutorial2_hierarchicalModel.html): How to model large-scale spatial variations?
-   [Tutorial 3](tutorials/tutorial3/tutorial3_covariates.html): How to model small-scale spatial variations?
-   [Tutorial 4](tutorials/tutorial4/tutorial4_diagnosticsPrediction.html): Advanced model diagnostics and prediction
-   [Conclusion](tutorials/day5_presentation.html)

## Raw code

The raw code of the website and tutorials can be found [here](<https://github.com/wpgp/bottom-up-tutorial>).
